TARGET DEFINITION: An oceanographic feature that involves wind-driven motion of dense, cooler, and usually nutrient-rich water towards the ocean surface, replacing the warmer, usually nutrient-deplete surface water.
--------------------
SOURCE DEFINITION: A marine upwelling is a net flow of marine water to the surface of the water column from deeper regions. This is often a result of surface water displacement off continental coasts by wind action. Localised upwellings may also occur along divergent fronts around eddies and along some of the major oceanographic features. Deeper waters often have higher nutrient content; consequently blooms of primary producers, such as planktonic algae, are generally observed around upwelling zones.

label: coastal upwelling
definition: An upwelling that is near a coast.

label: marine pelagic feature
definition: A prominent or distinctive aspect, quality, or characteristic of environments occurring within the marine water column.

label: marine algal bloom
definition: A marine algal bloom is a rapid increase or accumulation in the population of algae in a marine system. Typically, only one or a small number of phytoplankton  species are involved. Although there is no officially recognized threshold level, algae can be considered to be blooming at concentrations of hundreds to thousands of cells per milliliter, depending on the severity.

label: kelp forest
definition: Kelp forests are underwater areas with a high density of kelp. They are recognized as one of the most productive and dynamic ecosystems on Earth. Smaller areas of anchored kelp are called kelp beds.

label: marine benthic storm
definition: Benthic storms are strong benthic (near bottom) currents transporting sediment, created by the input of energy (largely kinetic) to the seabed. In regions with high mesoscale eddy activity, benthic storms are frequent and can create isohaline and isothermal conditions extending as much as 1000m above the seafloor.

label: marine downwelling
definition: A marine downwelling describes a net current of marine surface water towards deeper regions of the water column. Marine downwellings are usually caused by differences in the density (and hence, temperature and salinity) of seawater.

label: marine oxygen minimum zone
definition: A marine water mass which is characterized by having much lower than normal dissolved oxygen concentrations persistently.

label: marine current
definition: A water current which is maintained by a continuous, directed movement of marine water, generated by forces caused by breaking waves, wind, Coriolis force, temperature and salinity differences, and tides caused by the gravitational pull of astronomical bodies. Depth contours, shoreline configurations and interaction with other currents influence a current's direction and strength.

label: marine streamer
definition: Marine streamers are tongues of cold water that extend > 100 km offshore from upwelling regions. Enhanced primary productivity may occur in these waters as they are typically more nutrient rich than marine surface waters.

label: mesoscale marine eddy
definition: Mesoscale marine eddies are characterized by currents which flow in a roughly circular motion around the center of the eddy. The sense of rotation of these currents may either be cyclonic or anticyclonic. Ocean eddies are also usually made of water masses that are different to those outside of the eddy. Marine mesoscale eddies are between about 10 and 500 km in diameter, and persist for periods of days to months. They may be formed when an ocean current develops an instability. This instability grows, causing the current to meander, and eventually an eddy is pinched off from the meander.

label: marine Taylor column
definition: A marine Taylor column is a Taylor column that is formed in a marine body of water. Currents flowing over shoaling topography such as seamounts are accelerated and destabilised, resulting in Taylor columns. Eddies and internal waves are generated downstream of the topological feature and may extend 1000 m or so above them. This may result in a localised increase in primary production where the Taylor column reaches surface waters.

label: marine oligotrophic desert
definition: A marine water mass which is composed primarily of water with low concentrations of nutrients.

label: oceanic gyre
definition: A gyre in oceanography is any large system of rotating ocean currents, particularly those involved with large wind movements. Gyres are caused by the Coriolis Effect; planetary vorticity  along with horizontal and vertical friction, which determine the circulation patterns from the wind curl (torque).

label: deep ocean current
definition: A marine current that generally occurs below the permanent thermocline (where it occurs) or below 400 m depth and that is driven by density and temperature gradients.

label: marine surface current
definition: A marine current bordered by the surface of the water column and the permanent thermocline, where it occurs. Surface currents are mostly wind driven and mostly limited to the top 400 m of the water column. Ocean currents are driven by the circulation of wind above surface waters. Frictional stress at the interface between the ocean and the wind causes the water to move in the direction of the wind. Large ocean currents are a response of the atmosphere and ocean to the flow of energy from the tropics to polar regions. In some cases, currents are transient features and affect only a small area. Other ocean currents are essentially permanent and extend over large horizontal distances.

label: along-front current
definition: A marine surface current that flows along an oceanic front.

label: western boundary current
definition: A warm water, narrow marine surface current flowing from the equator to high latitudes at speeds between 40 and 120 kilometers per day. Western boundary currents are the deepest ocean surface flows, usually extending 1000 meters below the ocean surface.

label: eastern boundary current
definition: A cold water, broad marine surface current flowing from high latitudes to the equator at speeds between 3 and 7 kilometers per day.

label: marine benthic feature
definition: A prominent or distinctive aspect, quality, or characteristic of environments occurring on or along marine benthic environments.

label: marine cold-water sphere
definition: The marine cold-water sphere describes a water mass extending from the polar seas and across low latitudes at depths of ca. 800 to 1000 m, which is separated from the marine warm-water sphere by the permanent marine thermocline

label: marine warm-water sphere
definition: The marine warm-water sphere describes a water mass extending to depths of ca. 800 to 1000 m in low and middle latitudes. It is separated from the marine cold-water sphere by the permanent marine thermocline

label: marine hydrothermal vent
definition: A marine hydrothermal vent is a marine benthic feature where heat generated due to tectonic activity, either at divergent plate boundaries or convergent ocean plates where back-arc spreading occurs, is released or 'vented' to the surface. The resultant high temperature water jets are laden with dissolved metals and minerals.

label: marine hydrothermal vent chimney
subClassOf [LABEL]: marine benthic feature|solid astronomical body part
definition: A column of solid material which has been progressively deposited around a hydrothermal vent.

label: marine hydrothermal plume
definition: A marine hydrothermal vent plume, part of a marine hydrothermal vent, is a high temperature water jet laden with dissolved metals and minerals that is driven by heat generated due to tectonic activity below the vent.

label: marine coral reef deep fore reef
marine pockmark
definition: Pockmarks are craters in the seabed resulting from the release of gas or liquid. Generally, they are formed in soft, fine-grained seabed sediments by the escape of fluids (gas or water, but mainly methane) into the water column.

label: marine sponge reef
definition: A marine sponge reef is marine reefs primarily built by marine sponges. The primary frame-building sponges are all members of the order Hexactinosa. They are found only in glacier-scoured troughs of low-angle continental shelf. The seafloor is stable and consists of rock, coarse gravel, and large boulders.

label: mineral deposit
definition: A mineral deposit is a physiographic feature which has unusually high concentrations of one or more minerals.

label: white smoker
definition: A hydrothermal vent found on the ocean floor which emits lighter-hued minerals, such as those containing barium, calcium and silicon. These alkaline hydrothermal vents also continuously generate acetyl thioesters, providing both the starting point for more complex organic molecules and the energy needed to produce them.

label: seep
definition: A seep is a spring in which water has filtered through permeable earth to the surface.

label: cold seep
definition:
MERGED DEFINITION:
TARGET DEFINITION: A cold seep is a seep in which methane and other hydrocarbon-rich fluids rise to the sea floor.
--------------------
SOURCE DEFINITION: An area of the ocean floor where hydrogen sulfide, methane and other hydrocarbon-rich fluid seepage occurs. Cold seeps are distinct from hydrothermal vents: the former's emissions are of the same temperature as the surrounding seawater, whereas the latter's emissions are super-heated.

label: hydrothermal seep
definition: A hydrothermal seep is a seep in which diffuse flow of geothermally heated fluids with high methane concentrations. This seep has been proposed as an intermediate between cold seeps and hydrothermal vents.

label: structural basin
definition: A structural basin is a geological depression formed by tectonic warping of previously flat lying rock strata.

label: pingo scar
definition: A depression caused by the collapse of a pingo.

label: amictic lake
definition: A lake which is permanently covered by ice, does not mix, and exhibit inverse cold water stratification whereby water temperature increases with depth below the ice surface.

label: holomictic lake
definition: A holomictic lake is a lake which mixes at least once per year. Mixing is caused by a uniform temperature distribution from the upper to lower layers of the lake.

label: dimictic lake
definition: A dimitic lake is a holomictic lake which mixes from top to bottom during two mixing periods each year. Mixing typically occurs during the spring and autumn, when the lake is "isothermal" (i.e., at the same temperature from the top to the bottom). At this time the water throughout the lake is about 4°C, and, in the absence of any temperature or density differences, the lake readily mixes from top to bottom. These lakes are common in regions with temperate climates.

label: polymictic lake
definition: A polymictic lake is a holomictic lake which is too shallow to allow thermal stratification and which can mix from top to bottom through the ice-free period of the year.

label: monomictic lake
definition: A monomictic  lake is a holomictic lake which mixes from top to bottom during one mixing period each year.

label: cold monomictic lake
definition: A monomictic lake which is covered by ice throughout much of the year and only mixes when its surface ice melts and the lake lacks thermal stratification.

label: warm monomictic lake
definition: A monomictic lake which does not freeze and is thermally stratified throughout most of the year, only mixing in winter when cooler temperatures ease stratification.

label: cold polymictic lake
definition: A cold polymictic lake is a polymictic lake which is covered by ice in winter.

label: warm polymictic lake
definition: A warm polymictic lake is a polymictic lake which is not covered by ice at any point during the year.

label: crevice
definition: A deep fissure in rock.

label: freshwater river
definition: A river where fresh water flows.

label: continental margin
definition: A slope which is part of the seafloor, descends from the continental crust to the oceanic crust, and comprises the continental shelf, continental slope, and continental rise.

label: Taylor column
subClassOf [LABEL]: compound astronomical body part|fluid astronomical body part
definition: A Taylor column is a column of deflected fluid flow which is formed in a perturbed, rotating fluid, is parallel to the axis of rotation, and extends above the obstacle perturbing the fluid in a rigid manner.

label: atmospheric Taylor column
definition: An atmospheric Taylor column is a Taylor column that is formed in the atmosphere. Atmospheric Taylor columns often form above islands resulting in vortex streets in the atmosphere.

label: outcrop
definition: A portion of environmental material which protrudes through a surface layer.

label: rocky slope
definition: A rocky slope is a slope which has a surface primarily composed of rock.

label: gravelly slope
definition: A gravelly slope is a slope which has a surface primarily composed of gravel.

label: hillside
definition: A hillside is a slope that is part of a hill.

label: talus slope
definition: A talus slope is a slope which has a surface layer composed of scree.

label: maize field
definition: A field  used for the cultivation of corn or related crop plants.

label: field
definition: An unbroken expanse (as of ice)

label: marine mesoscale eddy field
definition: A mesoscale eddy field is an expanse of marine water which includes coherent vortices, as well as a rich cascade of other structures such as filaments, squirts and spirals and is characterized by temperature and salinity anomalies with associated flow anomalies that are nearly in geostrophic balance. Although only the surface expression of mesoscale eddies is visible in satellite images of sea surface height or temperature, they are in fact three dimensional structures that reach down into the pycnocline.

label: limestone cave
definition: A cave formed in limestone, usually by dissolution of limestone by acidic groundwater.

label: solutional cave
definition: A cave formed by the dissolution of soluble rock or other solid material such as limestone, chalk, dolomite, gypsum, salt or marble.

label: primary cave
definition: A cave formed at the same time as the surrounding rock.

label: inflationary cave
definition: A cave that is formed by the action of pressurised lava pushing against surrounding rock and then draining away.

label: erosional cave
definition: A cave formed by erosion caused by flowing streams carrying rocks or sediments.

label: glacier cave
definition: A glacier cave is a cave formed within or under a glacier.

label: ice cave
definition: An ice cave is a bedrock cave which contains year-round ice formations.

label: talus cave
definition: A talus cave is a cave formed by the openings between large boulders which have fallen into a random heap.

label: anchialine cave
definition: An anchialine cave is a cave which contains an anchialine pool.

label: anchialine pool
definition: An anchialine pool is a landlocked water body with a subterranean connection to the ocean and which has fresh water towards its surface with saline water in its deeper layers.

label: vadose cave
definition: A cave which is within a vadose zone.

label: domestic garden
definition: A garden that is associated with a human house. This association is generally one of spatial proximity or parthood.

label: burrow
definition: A burrow is a hole or tunnel excavated into the ground by an animal to create a space suitable for habitation, temporary refuge, or as a byproduct of locomotion

label: lava field
definition: A lava field is an expanse of flat-lying lava flows. Such features are generally composed of highly fluid basalt lava, and can extend for tens or even hundreds of miles across the underlying terrain.

label: lava flow
definition: A lava flow is a moving outpouring of lava, which is created during a non-explosive effusive eruption.

label: salt mass
definition: An accumulation of a salt, typically sodium chloride.

label: ravine
definition: A ravine is a small, narrow, steep-sided valley that is larger than a gully and smaller than a canyon and that is usually worn by running water.

label: salt glacier
definition: A mass of salt which has erupted onto a planetary surface, usually through sedimentary rock.

label: salt dome
definition: A dome-shaped mass of salt formed when a thick bed of evaporite minerals (mainly salt, or halite) found at depth intrudes vertically into surrounding rock strata, forming a diapir.

label: diapir
definition: A diapir is a type of geologic intrusion in which a more mobile and ductily deformable material is forced into brittle overlying rocks due to its higher buoyancy.

label: batholith
definition: A batholith is an area of mostly continuous plutonic (igneous intrusive) rock that covers an area larger than 100 square kilometers, formed in the planetary crust, and exposed by erosion. On Earth, Batholiths are almost always made mostly of felsic or intermediate rock-types, such as granite, quartz monzonite, or diorite.

label: latrine pit
definition: A latrine pit is an artificial hole or cavity in the ground used to collect human excreta.

label: rock intrusion
definition: An intrusion which is primarily composed of rock which has been formed within a pre-existing fracture in a larger mass of rock.

label: eutrophic lake
definition: A lake which has nutrient-rich water.

label: freshwater spring
definition: A spring which emits fresh water.

label: lentic water body
definition: A lentic water body is a water body in which the accumulated water, in its totality, has very little to no directed flow.

label: lotic water body
definition: A lotic water body is a water body in which the accumulated water, in its totality, is flowing.

label: chonolith
definition: A chonolith is an igneous rock intrusion of irregular shape with a demonstrable base, absent in other types of irregularly-shaped intrusions.

label: trench
definition: A trench is a type of excavation or depression in the ground that is generally deeper than it is wide (as opposed to a wider gully or ditch), and narrow compared to its length (as opposed to a simple hole).

label: ocean strait
definition: An ocean strait is a strait which connects two oceans.

label: undersea trough
definition: An undersea trough is a trough which is below a marine water body.

label: igneous intrusion
definition: An igneous intrusion is a mass of rock and minerals formed when magma cools, solidifies, and undergoes fractional crystallisation without reaching the surface.

label: tuff cone
definition: A cone that is composed of consolidated volcanic ash.

label: geological fracture
definition: A geological fracture is any separation in a geologic formation, such as a joint or a fault that divides a mass of rock into two or more pieces.

label: geological fault
definition: A geological fault is a planar fracture or discontinuity in a volume of rock, across which there has been significant displacement as a result of rock mass movement.

label: active geological fault
definition: An active fault is a fault that is likely to become the source of another earthquake sometime in the future. Geologists commonly consider faults to be active if there has been movement observed or evidence of seismic activity during the last 10,000 years.

label: vein
definition: A vein is a geological fracture which is filled with minerals precipitated out of an aqueous solution.

label: dike
definition: A sheet of rock that formed in a fracture in a pre-existing rock body.

label: geological joint
definition: A joint is a geological fracture which has no measureable shear displacement

label: shear fracture
definition: A geological fracture across which shear displacement has occurred

label: microfracture
definition: A microfracture is a small fracture which is found in a portion of solid material along which further fracturing tends to occur. Microfractures are considered imperfections which to pre-exist any fractures formed by the application of stress to a material.

label: atmospheric column
definition: A vertical pillar defined by a unit area on a planetary surface and bounded by the top of the atmosphere that is used to quantify an atmospheric parameter such as pressure, ozone or precipitable water.

label: polluted lake
definition: A lake which has concentrations of environmental contaminants high enough to harm the ecosystems associated with it.

label: water mass
definition: A mass of water.

label: marine water mass
definition: A mass of marine water.

label: coast
subClassOf [LABEL]: compound astronomical body part|fluid astronomical body part
definition: A coast is the area where land meets the sea, ocean, or lake.

label: lake coast
definition: The general region of indefinite width that extends from a lake inland to the first major change in terrain features.

label: flood
definition: An unusual accumulation of water above the ground caused by high tide, heavy rain, melting snow or rapid runoff from paved areas.

label: coastal flood
definition: A coastal flood is a flood which is formed as a result of large amounts of water from marine water bodies or large lakes being transported to usually dry land by displacement processes such as high winds or seismic activity.

label: riverine flood
definition: A riverine flood is a flood which is formed as a result of a river's flow rate exceeding the capacity of its channel.

label: flash flood
definition: A flash flood is a flood formed by the rapid flooding of geomorphic low-lying areas. It may be caused by heavy rain associated with a severe thunderstorm, hurricane, tropical storm, or meltwater from ice or snow flowing over ice sheets or snowfields. Flash floods may also occur after the collapse of a natural ice or debris dam, or a human structure such as a man-made dam. Flash floods are distinguished from a regular flood by a timescale of less than six hours.

label: storm surge
definition: A storm surge is a coastal flood which is caused by low-pressure weather systems such as tropical cyclones and strong extratropical cyclones, the severity of which is affected by the shallowness and orientation of the water body relative to storm path, and the timing of tides.

label: igneous extrusion
definition: A mass of igneous rock formed when hot magma flows out (extrudes) onto a planetary surface as lava or explodes violently into the atmosphere to fall back as pyroclastics or tuff.

label: clastic dike
definition: A dike formed when sediment fills a pre-existing fracture in a mass of rock.

label: stock
definition: A stock is a discordant igneous intrusion having a surface exposure of less than 100 square kilometres. Stocks differ from batholiths only in being smaller.

label: laccolith
definition: A sheet intrusion (or concordant pluton) that has been injected between two layers of sedimentary rock. The pressure of the magma is high enough that the overlying strata are forced upward, giving the laccolith a dome or mushroom-like form with a generally planar base.

label: lopolith
definition: A large igneous intrusion which is lenticular in shape with a depressed central region.

label: phacolith
definition: A phacolith is an intrusion parallel to the bedding plane or foliation of folded country rock. More specifically, it is a typically lens-shaped intrusion that occupies either the crest of an anticline or the trough of a syncline.

label: sill
definition: A tabular sheet intrusion that has intruded between older layers of sedimentary rock, beds of volcanic lava or tuff, or along the direction of foliation in metamorphic rock.

label: fumarole-derived ice tower
definition: A hollow tower of ice formed by the freezing of steam escaping a fumarole.

label: aeroform
definition: A part of an astronomical body which is primarily composed of a continuous volume of gaseous or aerosolised material held in shape by one or more environmental processes.

label: oligotrophic lake
definition: A lake which has nutrient-poor water.

label: mesotrophic lake
definition: A lake with medium nutrient levels, which allow moderate productivity.

label: astronomical body part
definition: A material part of an astronomical body.

label: biosphere
subClassOf [LABEL]: compound astronomical body part|fluid astronomical body part
definition: A biosphere is a part of an astronomical body which includes, as parts, all the living entities within the gravitational sphere of influence of that body, as well as the non-living and dead entities with which they interact.

label: cryosphere
definition: A cryosphere is that part of a planet which is primarily composed of water is in solid form.

label: hydrosphere
definition: An astronomical body part which is composed of the combined mass of water found on, under, and over the surface of a planet.

label: pedosphere
subClassOf [LABEL]: compound astronomical body part|fluid astronomical body part
definition: An astronomical body part which is composed of soil, subject to soil formation processes, and found on the surface of a lithosphere.

label: photosphere
definition: An astronomical body part which is composed of those parts of a star, distal from the star's core, from which light is radiated into space.

label: planetary photic zone
definition: A planetary part which is exposed, at least periodically, to light.

label: illuminated biosphere part
definition: An astronomical body part which includes those parts of a biosphere that are, at least periodically, illuminated and in which photosynthesis may occur.

label: exorheic lake
definition: A lake from which water constantly flows out of under almost all climatic circumstances, maintaining low concentrations of dissolved solid relative to endorheic lakes.

label: mouth of liquid discharge conduit
definition: A site at the terminus of a liquid conveyance conduit where the liquid carried is discharged into the sea or a river.

label: puddle of water
definition: A puddle is a small accumulation of water, on a surface. It can form either by pooling in a depression on the surface, or by surface tension upon a flat surface.

label: shrimp pond
definition: A lentic water body which is used for the artificial culture of shrimp.

label: geothermally heated river
definition: A river which is heated by geothermal processes such as heat exchange with lava or hydrothermal percolation.

label: petting zoo
definition: A petting zoo is a zoological garden which contains domesticated non-human animals and some wild non-human animals that are docile enough for humans to touch and feed.

label: plumbing drain
definition: An artificial channel which transports unwanted water or waste liquids away from their source, either to a more useful area, a receptacle, or into sewers or stormwater mains as waste discharge to be released or processed.

label: campground
definition: A part of an ecosystem which may be or has been used for one or more overnight stays by humans sheltering in tents, camper vans, caravans, or improvised shelters.

label: dedicated campground
definition: A campground which has been modified by humans to provide and maintain facilities for camping such as fire pits, road access, latrines, and garbage bins.

label: impromptu campground
definition: A campground which has no pre-existing facilities installed or maintained by humans, usually found outside of anthropised ecosystems.

label: vegetated hill
definition: A hill which has a surface that is partially or wholly covered by plant communities.

label: channel of an intermittent river
definition: A channel of an intermittent stream which contains a river when water supply exceeds evapotranspiration and bed seepage.

label: channel of an intermittent stream
subClassOf [LABEL]: container of an intermittent water body
definition: A channel through which a directional flow of water periodically occurs, ceasing when bed seepage or evapotranspiration exceed the available water supply.

label: technosphere
definition: A part of an astronomical body which includes, as parts, all the entities which have been constructed or manufactured by humans or their technology and which are within the gravitational sphere of influence of that body.

label: fairground
definition: A part of an ecosystem which has been allocated to host a gathering of people for multiple entertainment or commercial activities.

label: agricultural fairground
definition: A fairground which is used to exhibit agricultural technology, livestock, and farm-related activity.

label: market
definition: A part of an ecosystem where people gather for the purchase and sale of provisions, livestock, and other goods.

label: dry river
definition: A dry stream channel through which a river had flowed, but now contains no appreciable accumulations of water.

label: hypereutrophic lake
definition: A lake which is composed primarily of water with very high nutrient concentrations.

label: hypersaline lake
definition: A lake which is primarily composed of water with a concentration of dissolved salts greater than that of ocean water.

label: humic lake
definition: A lake which is composed primarily water with high concentrations of humic substances and organic acids, resulting in brown- or tea-coloured colouration.

label: natural lake
definition: A lake which has formed as the result of processes that are not or are only minimally driven by human activity.

label: caldera lake
definition: A lake which is contained within a caldera.

label: crater lake
definition: A lake contained within a crater.

label: meteorite lake
SYNONYMS: meteorite crater lake|meteorite impact crater lake
definition: A lake which is contained in a crater formed by a meteorite impact.

label: impact crater lake
definition: A lake which is contained in a crater formed by an impact event.

label: impact crater
definition: A crater which was formed as a result of the impact of one astronomical body on another.

label: anoxic lake
definition: A lake which is primarily composed of anoxic water.

label: lake with an anoxic hypolimnion
definition: A lake which has a hypolimnion composed primarily of anoxic water.

label: lake with a hypoxic hypolimnion
definition: A lake which has a hypolimnion composed primarily of hypoxic water.

label: hypoxic lake
definition: A lake which is primarily composed of hypoxic water.

label: oxic lake
definition: A lake which is primarily composed of oxic water.

label: lake with an oxic hypolimnion
definition: A lake which has a hypolimnion composed primarily of oxic water.

label: tectonic lake
definition: A lake which is contained in a depression formed by the deformation and resulting lateral and vertical movements of a lithosphere.

label: tectonic plate
definition: A part of a lithosphere which is separated by other such parts by geographic faults or similar geomorphological discontinuities.

label: rift zone
subClassOf [LABEL]: compound astronomical body part|fluid astronomical body part
definition: A compound astronomical body part in which extensional tectonic processes occur and where the lithosphere is being pulled apart.

label: aeolian lake
definition: A lake which fills a basin that has been dammed by wind-blown sand,  formed between sand dunes oriented by winds; or formed by wind action under previously arid paleoenvironments.

label: landslide lake
definition: A lake which fills a depression where drainage is blocked by solid material transported by a landslide.

label: rockslide lake
definition: A lake which fills a depression where drainage is blocked by solid material transported by a rockslide.

label: Karman vortex street
subClassOf [LABEL]: compound astronomical body part|fluid astronomical body part
SYNONYMS: Kármán vortex street|von Kármán vortex street
definition: A succession of swirling vortices caused by the unsteady separation of flow of a fluid around one or more blunt bodies.

label: fossil worm burrow
definition: A channel which was formed as a result of an annelid burrowing through soil, where organic residues lining the burrow have subsequently initiated fossilization.

label: coastal shrimp pond
definition: A shrimp pond which is embedded in a coastal water body.

label: hydroform
definition: A geographic feature which is primarily composed of a continuous volume of liquid water held in shape or sustained by an environmental process.

label: saline water body
definition: A body of water which is primarily composed of saline water.

label: fresh water body
definition: A body of water which is primarily composed of freshwater, with low solute content.

label: brackish water body
definition: A body of water which is primarily composed of brackish water.

label: marine tidal flow
definition: A marine current which is maintained by a tidal flow process.

label: desert
definition: A landform which has been rendered barren or partially barren by environmental extremes, especially by low rainfall.

label: neritic mussel reef
definition: A marine reef which is located on a shelf (i.e. in the neritic zone) and primarily composed of self-adhered or conglomerated mussel shells.

label: oceanic mussel reef
definition: A marine reef which is present in the depths beyond (offshore relative to) the continental shelf and primarily composed of self-adhered or conglomerated mussel shells.

label: Bathymodiolus-dominated oceanic mussel reef
definition: An oceanic mussel reef which is primarily settled by mussels of the genus Bathymodiolus and primarily composed of self-adhered or conglomerated mussel shells

label: mussel reef
definition: A marine reef which is primarily composed of self-adhered or conglomerated mussel shells.

label: terrestrial mountain
definition: A mountain which is located on land and which is bounded by an atmosphere or outer space.

label: polar mountain
definition: A mountain that is part of a polar environment.

label: temperate mountain
definition: A mountain that is part of a temperate environment.

label: tropical mountain
definition: A mountain that is part of a tropical environment.

label: high-elevation mountain
definition: A mountain which has a maximum elevation greater than 2500 metres above sea level.

label: mid-elevation mountain
definition: A mountain which has a maximum elevation between 300 and 2499 metres above sea level and slopes greater than or equal to two degrees of inclination.

label: UNEP-WCMC class 1 mountain
definition: A high-elevation mountain which has a maximum elevation greater than 4500 metres above sea level.

label: UNEP-WCMC class 2 mountain
definition: A high-elevation mountain which has a maximum elevation between 3500 and 4500 metres above sea level.

label: UNEP-WCMC class 3 mountain
definition: A high-elevation mountain which has a maximum elevation between 2500 and 3500 metres above sea level.

label: UNEP-WCMC class 4 mountain
definition: A mid-elevation mountain which has a maximum elevation between 1500 and 2499 metres above sea level and a slope greater than or equal to two degrees.

label: UNEP-WCMC class 5 mountain
definition: A mid-elevation mountain which has a maximum elevation between 1000 and 1499 metres above sea level and either 1) a slope greater than or equal to five degrees or 2) a local elevation range, within a 7 kilometre radius, of greater than 300 metres above sea level.

label: UNEP-WCMC class 6 mountain
definition: A mid-elevation mountain which has a maximum elevation between 300 and 999 metres above sea level and a local elevation range, within a 7 kilometre radius, of greater than 300 metres above sea level.

label: UNEP-WCMC class 7 mountain
definition: An elevated inner basin or plateau surrounded by mountains, but not - itself - a mountain.

label: liquid astronomical body part
subClassOf [LABEL]: compound astronomical body part|fluid astronomical body part
definition: A part of an astronomical body which is primarily composed of a continuous volume of liquid material, shaped by one or more environmental processes.

label: gaseous astronomical body part
subClassOf [LABEL]: compound astronomical body part|fluid astronomical body part
definition: A part of an astronomical body which is primarily composed of a continuous volume of gaseous material, shaped by one or more environmental processes.

label: fluid astronomical body part
definition: A part of an astronomical body which is primarily composed of a continuous volume of liquid or gaseous material, shaped by one or more environmental processes.

label: tornado
definition: A tornado is an aeroform consisting of at least one rapidly rotating column of air that is in contact with both the surface of an astronomical body and pendant from within or beneath a cumulonimbus or cumulus cloud.

label: fire whirl
definition: A fire whirl is a whirlwind induced by the contraction and rotation of intense, rising heat and turbulent, eddying air masses resulting from a large fire and made up of a core of burning matter surrounded by a rotating pocket of air.

label: multiple vortex tornado
definition: A tornado which comprises two or more columns of spinning air rotating about their own axis and at the same time around a common center.

label: landspout
SYNONYMS: dust-tube tornado|fair weather waterspout on land|land spout
definition: A tornado which a) is not associated with a mesocyclone and is thus relatively weak and short-lived, b) is centred on a small, smooth condensation funnel which often does not reach the planetary surface, and c) forms a distinctively laminar cloud of dust when it makes contact with the land.

label: waterspout
definition: A tornado which connects a cumulus or cumulonimbus cloud to a body of water, often transporting water from that water body along the spiraling winds constituting  its vortex.

label: spur
definition: A slope of land descending laterally from a hill, mountain or main crest of a ridge.

label: intrusion
definition: A mass of environmental material which has been formed as the result of its transport into an existing mass of another material.

label: flattened elevation
definition: An elevation which is flattened across its highest surface.

label: sea ice field
definition: An ice field which is primarily composoed of sea ice floes greater than 10 kilometers across.

label: glacier ice field
definition: An ice field which is constituted by a continuous accumulation of snow and glacier ice that completely fills a mountain basin or covers a low-relief mountain plateau.

label: sea ice hummock
definition: An elevation which is formed by pressure at the point of contact between ice floes, resulting in a conglomeration of broken ice.

label: frost-formed hummock
definition: A hummock which is primarily composed of soil that has been pushed up by frost action.

label: frost heave
definition: An elevation which is formed as an ice mass forms under soil, resulting in upwards deformation of the land surface.

label: water current
definition: A hydroform which is maintained by a continuous, directed movement of water, generated by disequilibria in a water mass.

label: gaseous part of an atmosphere
definition: That part of an atmosphere which is composed of gaseous material.

label: well-mixed estuary
definition: An estuary in which mixing by tidal forcing exceeds the force of riverine output, resulting in thorough homogenisation of the estuary's water column and the disappearance of a vertical salinity gradient and the freshwater-seawater boundary.

label: soil cryoturbate
definition: A mass of soil moved or disturbed by frost action.

label: thrust fault
definition: A fault across which older rocks are pushed above (away from the core of an astronomical body) younger rocks.

label: blind thrust fault
definition: A thrust fault which does not breach the surface of an astronomical body.

label: part of a landmass
definition: A solid astronomical body part which is part of the landmass of that body.

label: compound astronomical body part
definition: A part of an astronomical body which is primarily composed of a continuous medium bearing liquid, gaseous, and solid material in varying quantities.

label: inland sea
definition: A sea which shalowly covers central areas of continents during periods of high sea level that result in marine transgressions.

label: geothermally active field
definition: A field in which geothermal processes occur.

label: hydrothermal field
definition: A geothermally active field within which geothermally heated aqueous fluids are discharged from the the surface of a rocky planet.

label: gas well
definition: A well which has been drilled in order to extract natrual gas from subterranean reservoirs and bring it to the surface.

label: pit
definition: A depression in the ground resembling a hole or cavity, either natural or anthropogenic.

label: manure pit
definition: A pit which is used for the collection and storage of manure.

label: pockmark field
definition: A pockmark field is an undersea feature formed by shallow seabed depressions, typically several tens of metres across and a few metres deep. Generally, they are formed in soft, fine-grained seabed sediments by the escape of fluids (gas or water, but mainly methane) into the water column.

label: coastal water body
definition: Coastal water is a marine water body bordering a coast.

label: geographic basin
definition: A depression which is part of a planetary crust, is of geographic scale, and is partially or completely enclosed.

label: englacial stream
definition: A stream which is primarily composed of meltwater and which flows within a glacier or ice sheet.

label: supraglacial lake
definition: A water body which is located in a depression within the surface of a glacier.

label: cryoconite hole
definition: A vertical thaw hole within an ice mass, formed as a result of ice melt associated with local temperature increases, due to increased absorption of solar radiation by cryoconite deposits.

label: melt pond
definition: A water body which forms as a result of localised melting taking place on the surface of a glacier or a mass of sea ice and which is contained in the cavity formed by such melting.

label: brine channel
definition: A channel through which brine flows.

label: thaw hole
definition: A channel which traverses an ice mass floating on a water body and bridges the atmosphere to the underlying water through its internal cavity.

label: atmosphere-exposed melt pond
definition: A melt pond which has a surface exposed to the atmosphere.

label: ice-encased melt pond
definition: A melt pond which is completely encased in ice and thus not directly exposed to the atmosphere or underlying water.

label: intraglacial lake
definition: A lake which is comprised of meltwater located underneath or within a glacier.

label: thermokarst lake
definition: A freshwater lake which fills a depression formed by the erosion of thermokarst caused by permafrost thaw.

label: methane-releasing thermokarst lake
definition: A thermokarst lake through which methane gas released from thawing permafrost, or other methane stores, rises and escapes to the atmosphere.

label: thermokarst depression
definition: A geographic basin which is formed due to the erosion of thermokarst by meltwater released from thawing permafrost.

label: permafrost crater derived from a methane explosion
definition: A crater which is found in permafrost and formed as a result of an explosion fuelled by methane formerly contained in that permafrost.

label: cryoform
definition: A geographic feature which is primarily composed of a continuous mass of snow and/or ice.

label: channel
definition: A structure which traverses a mass of one or more environmental materials, and encloses a roughly tubular site.

label: atmosphere and water column exposed melt pond
definition: A melt pond which and is exposed to the atmosphere and to a lesser degree water underlying the ice mass which contains it.

label: water column exposed melt pond
definition: A melt pond which is formed close to that part of an ice mass which is in contact with some underlying water body, and which has channels connecting it to that water body.

label: subglacial lake
definition: A lake which is situated beneath a glacier.

label: firebreak
definition: A woodland clearing which is large enough to starve land fires of fuel, impeding their progress through wooded areas.

label: playground
definition: A park which has been designed for the recreation of children.

label: public park
definition: A park which is owned by a governmental or state entity and which is accessible by its citizenry (i.e. the public).

label: cloud part
subClassOf [LABEL]: compound astronomical body part|fluid astronomical body part
definition: A part of a cloud.

label: cloud base
definition: A cloud part which is closest to the surface of the astronomical body local to the cloud.

label: cloud top
definition: A cloud part which is furthest from the surface of the astronomical body local to the cloud.

label: polluted river
definition: A river which has elevated levels of contaminants.

label: water column
definition: A liquid astronomical body part which 1) vertically spans a water body and 2) has fiat boundaries approximating a columnar shape.

label: plastisphere
definition: A part of an astronomical body which includes, as parts, all the entities which are composed primarily of plastic and which are within the gravitational sphere of influence of that body.

label: manufactured plastisphere
definition: A plastisphere which is composed primarily of manufactured plastic.

label: algal bloom
definition: A feature that arises from a rapid increase or accumulation in the population of algae (typically microscopic) in an aquatic system.

label: freshwater algal bloom
definition: An algal bloom that is located in freshwater. Freshwater algal blooms are the result of an excess of nutrients, particularly some phosphates.
